intro: Coelospermum gmelinii, commonly known as the redroot false spiderwort, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to red in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its root system is fibrous and often reddish in color, which contributes to its common name. Coelospermum gmelinii thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats.
